DataElement.preferredName: Subject Vaccine Within 48 Hour Prior To Venous Blood Specimen Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/unknown indicator to signify whether the subject had a vaccination within 48 hours of blood draw.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Subject Vaccine Within 48 Hour Prior To Venous Blood Specimen
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed._Suspensions of killed or attentuated microorganisms (bacteria, viruses, or rickettsiae), or of antigenic proteins derived from them, administered for the prevention, amelioration, or treatment of infectious diseases or cancer._On the inside; contained in._A number with no fractional part.::48_In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Blood carried in veins, generally deoxygenated blood containing urea and other waste products which is transported through the venous system to the heart and lungs. The exception is blood within the pulmonary vein which is oxygenated and travels from the lungs to the left atrium of the heart._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed.:Suspensions of killed or attentuated microorganisms (bacteria, viruses, or rickettsiae), or of antigenic proteins derived from them, administered for the prevention, amelioration, or treatment of infectious diseases or cancer.

Concepts.definition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed.
Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response.

Property.preferredName: Within Integer::48 Hour Prior To Venous Blood Specimen
Property.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:A number with no fractional part.::48:In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Blood carried in veins, generally deoxygenated blood containing urea and other waste products which is transported through the venous system to the heart and lungs. The exception is blood within the pulmonary vein which is oxygenated and travels from the lungs to the left atrium of the heart.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

Blood carried in veins, generally deoxygenated blood containing urea and other waste products which is transported through the venous system to the heart and lungs. The exception is blood within the pulmonary vein which is oxygenated and travels from the lungs to the left atrium of the heart.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text terms to determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has subject had any vaccine within 48 hours prior to blood draw?
